trans-unit.source: Frequently asked questions
trans-unit.target: Frequently asked questions

trans-unit.source: Frequently asked questions (FAQs)
trans-unit.target: Frequently asked questions (FAQs)

trans-unit.source: Frequently asked questions
trans-unit.target: Frequently asked questions

trans-unit.source: Overview
trans-unit.target: Overview

trans-unit.source: Q: How do you scale indexing?
trans-unit.target: Q: How do you scale indexing?

trans-unit.source: A: The reserved units are the same for Encoding and Indexing tasks.
trans-unit.target: A: The reserved units are the same for Encoding and Indexing tasks.

trans-unit.source: Follow instructions on <link><linkText>How to Scale Encoding Reserved Units</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Follow instructions on <link><linkText>How to Scale Encoding Reserved Units</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Note that Indexer performance is not affected by Reserved Unit Type.
trans-unit.target: Note that Indexer performance is not affected by Reserved Unit Type.

trans-unit.source: Q: I uploaded, encoded, and published a video.
trans-unit.target: Q: I uploaded, encoded, and published a video.

trans-unit.source: What would be the reason the video does not play when I try to stream it?
trans-unit.target: What would be the reason the video does not play when I try to stream it?

trans-unit.source: A: One of the most common reasons is you do not have at least one reserved streaming unit allocated on the streaming endpoint from which you are trying to playback.
trans-unit.target: A: One of the most common reasons is you do not have at least one reserved streaming unit allocated on the streaming endpoint from which you are trying to playback.

trans-unit.source: Follow instructions on <link><linkText>How to Scale Streaming Reserved Units</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: Follow instructions on <link><linkText>How to Scale Streaming Reserved Units</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Q: Can I do compositing on a live stream?
trans-unit.target: Q: Can I do compositing on a live stream?

trans-unit.source: A: Compositing on live streams is currently not offered in Azure Media Services, so you would need to pre-compose on your computer.
trans-unit.target: A: Compositing on live streams is currently not offered in Azure Media Services, so you would need to pre-compose on your computer.

trans-unit.source: Q: Can I use Azure CDN with Live Streaming?
trans-unit.target: Q: Can I use Azure CDN with Live Streaming?

trans-unit.source: A: Media Services supports integration with Azure CDN (for more information, see <link><linkText>How to Manage Streaming Endpoints in a Media Services Account</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: A: Media Services supports integration with Azure CDN (for more information, see <link><linkText>How to Manage Streaming Endpoints in a Media Services Account</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: You can use Live streaming with CDN.
trans-unit.target: You can use Live streaming with CDN.

trans-unit.source: Azure Media Services provides Smooth Streaming, HLS and MPEG-DASH outputs.
trans-unit.target: Azure Media Services provides Smooth Streaming, HLS and MPEG-DASH outputs.

trans-unit.source: All these formats use HTTP for transferring data and get benefits of HTTP caching.
trans-unit.target: All these formats use HTTP for transferring data and get benefits of HTTP caching.

trans-unit.source: In live streaming actual video/audio data is divided to fragments and this individual fragments get cached in CDN.
trans-unit.target: In live streaming actual video/audio data is divided to fragments and this individual fragments get cached in CDN.

trans-unit.source: Only data needs to be refreshed is the manifest data.
trans-unit.target: Only data needs to be refreshed is the manifest data.

trans-unit.source: CDN periodically refreshes manifest data.
trans-unit.target: CDN periodically refreshes manifest data.

trans-unit.source: Q: Does Azure Media services support storing images?
trans-unit.target: Q: Does Azure Media services support storing images?

trans-unit.source: A: If you are just looking to store JPEG or PNG images, you should keep those in Azure Blob Storage.
trans-unit.target: A: If you are just looking to store JPEG or PNG images, you should keep those in Azure Blob Storage.

trans-unit.source: There is no benefit to putting them in your Media Services account unless you want to keep them associated with your Video or Audio Assets.
trans-unit.target: There is no benefit to putting them in your Media Services account unless you want to keep them associated with your Video or Audio Assets.

trans-unit.source: Or if you might have a need to use the images as overlays in the video encoder.
trans-unit.target: Or if you might have a need to use the images as overlays in the video encoder.

trans-unit.source: Media Services encoder supports overlaying images on top of videos, and that is what it lists JPEG and PNG as supported input formats.
trans-unit.target: Media Services encoder supports overlaying images on top of videos, and that is what it lists JPEG and PNG as supported input formats.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>Creating Overlays</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>Creating Overlays</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: Q: How can I copy assets from one Media Services account to another.
trans-unit.target: Q: How can I copy assets from one Media Services account to another.

trans-unit.source: A: To copy assets from one Media Services account to another, use <link><linkText>IAsset.Copy</linkText><title></title></link> extension method available in the <link><linkText>Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions</linkText><title></title></link> repository.
trans-unit.target: A: To copy assets from one Media Services account to another, use <link><linkText>IAsset.Copy</linkText><title></title></link> extension method available in the <link><linkText>Azure Media Services .NET SDK Extensions</linkText><title></title></link> repository.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see <link><linkText>this</linkText><title></title></link> forum thread.
trans-unit.target: For more information, see <link><linkText>this</linkText><title></title></link> forum thread.
